hero.title: Hey, I'm Thomas Harmon.
hero.subtitle: I'm a full-stack software engineer in Boston, MA.
hero.blurb: My combined major in Computer Engineering and Computer Science has made me a jack-of-all trades and a master at quickly learning new skills. My specialities are in back-end development, system design, and machine learning. Feel free to connect with me through any of the following:

about.content: I'm a fifth year student at Northeastern University, currently applying for full time jobs starting in May of 2020. At Northeastern I found a passion for back-end software engineering and have gained invaluable real-world experience during numerous internships. I especially enjoy machine learning and working with modern technology stacks. I was originally born and raised in Hawaii, and during my co-ops I have found that it has given me a unique insight and perspective. One day I hope to retire there so I can focus on my passions of surfing and glassblowing.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
details: Full stack development of a SaaS application with React, NodeJS, and Java.
Orchestrated redesign of a J2EE monolithic web application into a Micro-Service Oriented Architecture and monetizable API.
Researched, implemented, and presented database optimizations for increasing performance of customer features by 5-30x.
Collaborated with other developers by pair programming. Practice Agile Development under a Continuous Flow framework.

jobs.title: Undergraduate Researcher
details: Developed facial recognition and person following packages using ROS, Python, and C++ for the Toyota HSR in a RoboCup@Home competition.
Competed in a RoboCup@Home competition in Montreal, Canada as part of a team of researchers. Placed 4th internationally.
Researched optical flow, implementing multiple algorithms and testing performance. Conceived of and built a prototype autonomous navigation system based on optical flow using ROS, Python, and OpenCV.

jobs.title: Advanced Concepts Engineer
details: Created a Java application to translate system engineering models between the modeling languages OpenMETA and sysML.
Designed a graph database to support continuous integration of system engineering models to modernize the file system approach in use.
Integrated database and Java app into a continuous integration workflow for engineering models, greatly improving engineering efficiency.
Utilized ANSYS Electronic Desktop to model operational effects of varying RF wavelengths on a PCB based on trace dimensions.

projects.name: Touchless User Interface
projects.description: A year long, team capstone project to build a computer-vision based touchless user interface with a monocular RGB camera and machine learning. Allows for static or dynamic gestures to be trained on demand and linked to a repository of IoT actions and applications.

projects.name: ML Futures Volume Prediction
projects.description: An experiment to test the effectiveness of different RNN architectures on predicting the volume of S&P500 e-mini futures. An RNN, LSTM, and GRU were built, trained and tested to see the performance difference of the architecutre evolutions of an RNN.

projects.name: Personal Website
projects.description: A personal first foray into the realm of web development in order to build this website to host my personal projects and professional website. Built with Gatsby and React for a blazing fast experience.

projects.name: NUFS File System
projects.description: A file system which implements the FUSE API, with support for reading and writing small files (under 4kB), deleting, renaming, linking, nested directories, and large files.

projects.name: Memory Allocator
projects.description: A fast and dynamic memory allocator to emulate malloc from the C standard library. Uses a number of optimization techniques to improve speed and reduce memory fragmentation.

projects.name: Shell
projects.description: A basic Unix shell implementation with support for command line operations such as redirects, piping, background operations, && and || operations, and the ; operation.

projects.name: Animator
projects.description: A project focused on OOD principles and practices, specfically the MVC pattern. The goal of this project was to design an interactive animator application that was modular and easily extensible. Throughout the project, different views and controllers were designed to demonstrate these principles.

projects.name: Glassblowing
projects.description: A passion of mine is glassblowing. I first learned how to blow glass at Punahou School, my highschool in Honolulu, Oahu. I became one of the most dedicated students in our class, regularly spending the entire school day in the shop after I finished my AP exams. I've since carried on my passions at Diablo Glass School in Boston.
